Hey everyone, just wanted to drop in and say I haven't forgotten about these mods.

As far as I know, the current version works fine in 1.1.3.

For the new update, I'm going to try to balance the parameters of the parts and do texture tweaks. I'm going to scrap the new model for now - as evidenced, I just don't have the time anymore to get that working. I may pick it up again in the future.

Stay tuned.

Coming soon...  
  
![KttSVQn.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/KttSVQn.jpg)  

Three new parts. This will be a save-breaking update so make backups. The 1.25m Phoenix/Dragon will be no more. Instead, you'll have these.  

1.25m - Cygnus style <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> container with monoprop, electric charge, and <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr>.  

2.5m - The current Phoenix/Dragon capsule + all its parts, and the new HTV style <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> container with integrated solar panels, monoprop, electric charge, and <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr>.  

3.75m - ATV style <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> container with a lot of monoprop, electric charge, <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr>, and high-level probe core with MechJeb enabled.

Still balancing the parts, but they all work in-game so expect them soon.

I'm quite excited. I felt bad because there were a lot of people looking forward to the new models for the original CRS stuff, but I just got burnt out on it. 

I decided to add to the mod and make parts that I also needed a use for, so hopefully others will too. Now that I think I have solar panels figured out, I'm going to make a set specifically for the Cygnus part and for the ATV part as well.
OMG THIS IS AMAZING!

Okay, I finally got the solar panels for the ATV craft to work. Turns out solar panels that track the sun are a giant pain in the cheeks. 

I was going to try to make a set specific for the Cygnus but I may just say forget it, and use stock panels. 

Anyway, all that's left is a Trunk-to-2.5 adapter and this will be ready to update.

Adapter is made and works. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Don't forget there are precision tools in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> editor since 1.0 that allow you to position and rotate a part more. 

For instance, the Phoenix capsule with a docking port on top - and the stock nose cone on top of that - leaves a small gap between the top of the Phoenix capsule and the bottom of the nose cone. Use the position tool in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> editor to bring the nosecone down slightly and make it look right. 

I do the same thing with radial parachutes on the capsule - to "hide" them beneath the surface of the capsule mesh.

Update is up on SpaceDock!  

Remember, this is a **save-breaking update. Make back-ups and remove previous CRS parts from your ships.**  

Also, this is tested against KSP 1.2 **but <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> and MechJeb have not been updated to 1.2 yet. To enjoy the full functionality of this mod I recommend playing KSP 1.1.3 and using <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> and MechJeb until they have been updated to 1.2.**

Hey, some things I noticed about the new update.

If it's rated for 1.2, I think the probe cores are missing the new data transmitter, and none of the <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> use the new RCSFX system, so they look a little outdated. Another thing I noticed is that <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> blocks on Cygnus' right side is an awkward see-through, So maybe you accidentally deleted the face when modeling it. I'll fetch a screenshot of what I'm talking about in a second. If you don't know what to do about the 1.2 changed(<abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr>, Data Transmitter) you can PM me and I think I can help with it. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
